Feb 1 (Reuters) - Ups UPS.N:

  • CEO ON CONF CALL - "WE HAD HIGHER VOLUME THAN WE EXPECTED AT THE BEGINNING OF THE QUARTER AND LOWER VOLUME AT THE END"

  • CEO - "IN 2021, OUR SMB AVERAGE DAILY VOLUME GREW 18% AND REPRESENTED 26.8% OF OUR TOTAL U.S. VOLUME, PUTTING US ON TRACK TO ACHIEVE OUR 2023 TARGET"

  • CEO - EXPECT DIGITAL ACCESS PROGRAM TO BE A MORE THAN $2 BILLION BUSINESS IN 2022

  • CEO - "IN THE FOURTH QUARTER, OUR INTERNATIONAL SMB REVENUE GROWTH RATE WAS 18%"

  • CEO -"IN REGARD TO CAPEX, WE ARE INCREASING OUR INVESTMENTS BACK INTO THE BUSINESS TO DRIVE INNOVATION AND GROWTH....OVERTIME WILL PUT RFID TAG ON ALL OF OUR PACKAGES"

  • CFO -REVENUE PER PIECE GREW ACROSS ALL PRODUCTS AND CUSTOMER SEGMENTS WITH GROUND REVENUE PER PIECE UP 10%.IN US DOMESTIC BUSINESS

  • CFO -DECREASED STAFFING LEVELS AND RETURNED RENTAL EQUIPMENT EARLY, WHICH HELPED LOWER Y-O-Y OPERATING EXPENSE GROWTH RATE IN Q4

  • CFO -OPERATING MARGIN OF 13.5% IN 2021 WAS THE HIGHEST CONSOLIDATED OPERATING MARGIN WE'VE HAD IN 14 YEARS

  • CFO -EXPECT DOMESTIC OPERATING MARGIN TO EXPAND 50 BPS IN 2022

  • CFO -IN U.S. DOMESTIC, WE ANTICIPATE REVENUE GROWTH OF AROUND 5.5% WITH REVENUE PER PIECE GROWING FASTER THAN VOLUME IN 2022

  • CFO - IN INTERNATIONAL SEGMENT REVENUE GROWTH IS ANTICIPATED TO BE APPROXIMATELY 7.7% WITH VOLUME GROWING SLIGHTLY FASTER THAN REVENUE IN 2022

  • CFO - "WE EXPECT INTERNATIONAL DEMAND-RELATED SURCHARGES TO REMAIN ELEVATED IN 2022"

  • CFO - "IN SUPPLY CHAIN SOLUTIONS, WE EXPECT REVENUE TO BE AROUND $17 BILLION IN 2022; EXPECT OCEAN SURCHARGE RATES TO MODERATE BELOW 2021 PEAK LEVELS"

  • CFO - FY NET IMPACT IS EXPECTED TO BE AROUND $570 MILLION ON OPERATING PROFIT IN SUPPLY CHAIN SOLUTIONS, WHICH WILL BE SPREAD EVENLY ACROSS QUARTERS

  • CFO - ABOUT 60% OF OUR CAPITAL SPENDING PLAN WILL BE ALLOCATED TO GROWTH PROJECTS AND ABOUT 40% TO MAINTENANCE

  • CFO - WILL TAKE DELIVERY OF 2 NEW 747-8 AIRCRAFT IN 2022 AND WILL MAKE PREDELIVERY PAYMENTS ON 19 BOEING 767 FREIGHTERS ANNOUNCED IN DECEMBER

  • CFO - WILL PURCHASE OVER 3,700 ALTERNATIVE FUEL VEHICLES IN 2022, INCLUDING AROUND 425 ARRIVAL ELECTRIC DELIVERY VEHICLES TO BE DEPLOYED IN U.S. AND EUROPE

  • CEO - AMAZON'S REVENUE SURGED WITH US IN 2022; ITS PERCENT OF OUR TOTAL REVENUE WAS 11.7% IN 2021 VERSUS 11.6% IN 2019

  • CEO - THE SMALL PACKAGE MARKET IS EXPECTED TO GROW ABOUT 5% IN 2022; ENVIRONMENT SUPPORTS FIRM PRICING

  • CEO - WE ARE WELL ON THE WAY ON MEETING OUR 60 MILLION TARGET OF RETURNS PACKAGES

  • CFO- COST PER PIECE IN THE U.S., WHICH IS SORT OF 3-PLUS PERCENT, I WOULD EXPECT THAT NUMBER TO BE HIGHER IN H1 AND SLIGHTLY LOWER IN 2H
